#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Respond when Someone Wishes You Happy Birthday
#Text=It 's your birthday !
#Text=It 's great to see that your friends care about you , but what 's an appropriate way to respond ?
#Text=In person , just say " Thank you ! "
#Text=If the well-wishes are sent over social media or physical mail , the etiquette can be a little different , but it 's not difficult to learn .
#Text=Steps
#Text=On Social Media
#Text=Post one thank you message .
#Text=If you use social media frequently , you might get birthday wishes from acquaintances , old friends , and people you do n't even remember .
#Text=Even your friends are probably not waiting anxiously to receive a personalized response .
#Text=One message to your wall thanking everyone for the birthday wishes is common practice , and unlikely to offend anyone .
#Text=Here are some example responses :
#Text=Thank you everyone for the birthday wishes !
#Text=I 'm having a great time !
#Text=One man .
#Text=One birthday .
#Text=So many great birthday messages . : )
#Text=IT'S MY BIRTHDAY SO I GET TO USE CAPS LOCK .
#Text=Thank you for the kind thoughts everyone !
#Text=Check out the examples section for more ideas .
#Text=Post a picture instead ( optional ) .
#Text=If you want to thank people in a more visible way , take a photo of your smiling face in a party hat , a birthday cake , or another birthday symbol .
#Text=Post it along with a comment thanking everyone for their birthday wishes .
#Text=This shows that you put a little effort into making your thanks special , but is still fairly simple to do .
#Text=Reply to messages that go the extra distance .
#Text=If someone posts a long , heartfelt birthday wish over social media , reply to it in person .
#Text=Post a reply at least three sentences long .
#Text=You can reply directly to the comment , or in a private message .
#Text=There 's no need to respond with a new post on the other person 's wall .
#Text=Older relatives , " low tech " people , and people who do n't use social media much are all more likely to expect an individual response .
#Text=You can use the opportunity to reconnect with friends you have n't seen in a long time , even if they only posted a short message for your birthday .
#Text=Respond briefly to other posts ( optional ) .
#Text=As mentioned above , there is no need to respond to every person individually .

#Text=However , if you 'd like to take the extra time , you could " Like " each Facebook post , or reply to any social media post with a short comment such as " Thanks for thinking of me ! " or " Thanks , I appreciate it ! "
#Text=In Person
#Text=Thank someone in person .
#Text=When possible , thank someone in person after he gives you a birthday present , or puts extra effort into a birthday wish .
#Text=Give each friend or group of friends your full attention , smile , and make eye contact while delivering your thanks .
#Text=Here are some ideas on how to do it :
#Text=Your card meant a lot to me .
#Text=It really cheered me up .
#Text=That was the perfect birthday gift !
#Text=You know me so well .
#Text=See the example section below for more ideas .
#Text=Send a card , email or letter .
#Text=Relatives and friends older than yourself tend to appreciate receiving a thank you card in the mail .
#Text=Always add a handwritten message .
#Text=A short thank you message is fine , but adding a heartfelt message is recommended for people who have been unusually generous or kind .
#Text=Look at the examples section if you need ideas on what to write .
#Text=Be specific .
#Text=Make your friend feel special for her contribution to your birthday celebration , and to your life .
#Text=Mention the specific gift she gave you , or the card she sent .
#Text=Tell her how you will use the gift , or that you will " enjoy it for a long time . "
#Text=Say what your friend wants to hear .
#Text=Never criticize the gift your friend sent you , bring up something embarrassing , or do anything else that might upset him .
#Text=If you dislike the gift , try to find something about it that you do enjoy , or thank him for taking the time to pick out ( or create ) such a thoughtful gift .
#Text=Example Responses
#Text=Give out compliments .
#Text=Let the well-wishers know how wonderful they are , and how much you appreciate them .
#Text=You can use more specific compliments that match your friends ' , or use these examples :
#Text=Thank you , that 's such a kind thing to say !
#Text=Thank you , you 've been a bright and wonderful part of my life .
#Text=I 'm so lucky to have a group of friends like you .
#Text=Give yourselves a pat on the back for being such great friends this past year .
#Text=Tell everyone how much the wishes meant to you .
#Text=Let your friends know you appreciate the positive effect they have on your life .
#Text=Here are a couple examples :
#Text=Your message gave me a smile that lasted all day .
#Text=It was so wonderful to hear from you .
#Text=You made my birthday so special .
#Text=Post something unique .
#Text=If you 're posting a mass thank you message on social media , sometimes you want to stand out a little .
#Text=Try one of the following ideas :
#Text=Say something funny , like " It feels great to have so many friends wishing me a happy birthday . You can all have 1/207 of my birthday cake . "
#Text=Say " Thank you ! " in different languages .
#Text=Try Salamat ! , Foole tunk ! , or pick your favorites by searching online .
#Text=Link to a video .
#Text=There are many " thank you " videos available online , or you can find a clip from your favorite movie , band , or cute animal acting excited .
#Text=Give a serious , meaningful thank you .
#Text=Sometimes , it feels great to communicate your sincere , deep appreciation for a full year of kindness and support .
#Text=Tweak these examples to include specific events in your life for greater effect :
#Text=Image :
#Text=Respond when Someone Wishes You Happy Birthday Step 12 . jpg
#Text=I feel blessed every day , but most of all on the day when my friends send a flood of support and smiles .
#Text=Thank you everyone for reminding me what matters on my birthday this year . "
